intro: Dysodidendron ceylanicum, commonly known as the Ceylon dysodidendron, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has smooth, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
